title: Savannah-Chatham police arrest 3 and seek another in September murder investigation

By Savannah Morning News Savannah-Chatham police have arrested three and are seeking a fourth suspect in a September shooting that killed two and injured another.
Emile Randolph, 32; Asim Simmons, 19; and Tom Frazier, 18 were arrested and charged during the police department’s investigation of a September shooting that killed Jayquan Turner, 24, and Javon Wilson,19, said Eunicia Baker, Savannah-Chatham police spokeswoman. Simmons was also injured during the shooting, Baker said.
On Sept. 12, shots were fired on the 1400 block of Barnes Drive as the victims and suspects in this case met outside of an apartment building to settle a dispute about a robbery that occurred the day before, Baker said.
Randolph, who was charged with possession of a firearm by a convicted felon on Sept. 18, is now charged with murder. His warrants were served at the Chatham County Detention Center.
Frazier was arrested at an apartment on the 11000 block of White Bluff Road and charged with armed robbery. Asim Simmons was arrested on the 100 block of Queen’s Retreat and charged with murder and armed robbery.
Police have an arrest warrant for Quamelius Lee, 20, who is wanted for murder and armed robbery and are seeking the public’s assistance in locating him.
Lee is described as a 5-foot-11 black male, weighing 140 pounds, Baker said. Anyone with information on his whereabouts should call 911 immediately.
The Southeast Region Fugitive Task Force (SERTF), the Undercover Narcotics Investigation Team (UNIT), metro’s K9 and Southside Precinct Crime Suppression units aided in the arrests.
Anyone with information on Lee’s location should call Crimestoppers at 912-234-2020 or text CRIMES (274637) using the keyword CSTOP2020. Tipsters remain anonymous and may qualify for a cash reward.
A confidential tip line also is open directly to investigators at 912-525-3124.
